title: Grilled Tuna With Cherry-tomato Salad And Herbed Bulghur
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Grilled Tuna With Cherry-tomato Salad And Herbed Bulghur a try. One serving contains 401 calories, 45g of protein, and 11g of fat. This recipe serves 4. For $6.74 per serving, this recipe covers 39% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. The Fourth Of July will be even more special with this recipe. If you have mint leaves, pepper, scallions, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free and pescatarian diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 38 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 90%, this dish is awesome. Try Grilled Tuna with Cherry-Tomato Salad and Herbed Bulghur, Grilled Tuna With Cherry Tomato Salsa, and Tuna, Artichoke and Cherry Tomato Salad for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Tunan on the menu? Try pairing with Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. The Enate Cabernet Sauvignon Merlot with a 4.8 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 19 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Enate Cabernet Sauvignon Merlot
productMatches.description: Fully ruby color. A complex blackcurrant, blackberry aroma with a touch of violet and hints of red pepper, vanilla and herbs. Smooth and round mouthfeel; the soft tannic cushion gives way to a flavorsome palate which releases pleasant honey-roast aromas. The well-balanced acidity will ensure improvement in the bottle over the next five years.
